title: Tutorials: downloadable Python examples don't work from-the-box...
body_html:
Hi all! And thank you for the tutorials!

I've just tried to download the Python examples from the PyTorch tutorials and simply run them on my machine (Windows 7x64, Python 3.6, fresh version of PyTorch).

https://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/blitz/cifar10_tutorial.html
https://pytorch.org/tutorials/_downloads/cifar10_tutorial.py --- this is the one I've just tried to run.

Alas, they don't run correctly (while the IPython notebooks still do). Maybe they lack if __name__ == "__main__", maybe something else.

Can you correct the Python examples?
body_text:
Hi all! And thank you for the tutorials!
I've just tried to download the Python examples from the PyTorch tutorials and simply run them on my machine (Windows 7x64, Python 3.6, fresh version of PyTorch).
https://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/blitz/cifar10_tutorial.html
https://pytorch.org/tutorials/_downloads/cifar10_tutorial.py --- this is the one I've just tried to run.
Alas, they don't run correctly (while the IPython notebooks still do). Maybe they lack if __name__ == "__main__", maybe something else.
Can you correct the Python examples?
body:
Hi all! And thank you for the tutorials!

I've just tried to download the Python examples from the PyTorch tutorials and simply run them on my machine (Windows 7x64, Python 3.6, fresh version of PyTorch).

https://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/blitz/cifar10_tutorial.html
https://pytorch.org/tutorials/_downloads/cifar10_tutorial.py --- this is the one I've just tried to run.

Alas, they don't run correctly (while the IPython notebooks still do). Maybe they lack `if __name__ == "__main__"`, maybe something else.

Can you correct the Python examples?
